metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28010 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim 4 before 4.94.2 allows Out-of-bounds Write because the main function, while setuid root, copies the current working directory pathname into a buffer that is too small (on some common platforms).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-base - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-config - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
exim4-daemon-light - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
eximon4 - 4.94-15ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> code introduced later, xenial and trusty ESM not affected

criterions.comment: exim4 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.94-15ubuntu1.2').
